AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle: White Malibu sedan associated with RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR., stopped by United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge Luis Trevino near Farm-to-Market Road 2050, transporting undocumented aliens, including five passengers and two in the trunk, driven on a road primarily used by local residents and oil company employees, registered to Hertz Rental Car Company, exhibiting suspicious behavior such as driving in tandem with another vehicle and repeatedly going on and off Farm-to-Market Road 2050

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.undocumented aliens: individuals being transported in vehicles stopped by United States Border Patrol agents

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol Agent with nearly seven years of experience, stationed at the Freer Immigration Checkpoint for over a year, familiar with local traffic patterns and residents

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Officer Reymundo Reyes: Freer Police Department officer who conducted a traffic stop on IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle and observed his extreme nervousness, asked questions about travel plans and vehicle ownership
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marco Montemayor: Special Agent for the United States Department of Homeland Security, conducted an interview with IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and ensured he understood his Miranda rights
